Aardvark
HongKongFuiI am testing flash flood at the moment, maybe at later levels it works.

No, it doesn't. It's crap. Doesn't do nearly enough damage to make it worthwhile and is easily countered by disarm functions, especially sabotage.
I have a level 122 brute with flash flood and around 10 weapons including flail, axe, bumps and halberd, and it's still a liability. Mostly uses it when has lost / used most of the weapons, so wastes a whole turn to throw maybe 3-4 weapons, for perhaps 100-175 damage. You need to be doing way more than that at level 122 if you want to win the fight.
It also seems to count as a heavy weapon strike, so your opponent will typically get two attacks on you immediately after the flash flood, which is often fatal.

Question. Is Net worth it? Generally speaking.
(if you give an opinion, say why)
On february 28, 2016
[895738]
Jane-NarbonQuestion. Is Net worth it? Generally speaking.
(if you give an opinion, say why)

if you have bomb, not really. My first old brute had both. Half the time he sequenced it right, half the time he didn't.

Putting bomb aside, the net alone is good against pets. You could consider fighting the pet owners, which have very low HP and are generally easy to kill. By pets I mainly mean the bear and the panther/wolf.

Aside from its use against pets, it also has an excellent combo with heavy weapons like bumps, flail and the hammer because a netted target cannot dodge the weapon. Combined with fierce brute, you have a chance of a guaranteed one-shot kill.

However, there's the chance that you'll use it and then just punch the target and there goes the net.

What does your brute have that would make the net worthwhile?

[895738]
NereusAxe or 3 speed?
http://mybrute.muxxu.com/fight/141993...Jane-NarbonALWAYS pick Axe. You can't axe for a better weapon.

For the record, axe refers to that stone hammer weapon. For some odd reason, it's called axe. The actual axe in game is referred to as a hatchet.

As for Nereus' brute, if that is the right link, you've got a level 120+ brute, right? The axe would be good if your brute has the accuracy. Net is a good combo with this weapon, provided that your opponent does not have pets. Honestly I don't know what would be great for such a high level brute, when you would have pretty much everything you need. It seems like you would just level up stats because if you pick up more weapons, that might skew your victory chances depending on what they are.

You also can "axe" for a better weapon, and that's the flail. Although it does less damage, it has a multi-hit chance, a counter chance and is a bit more accurate and it has a lower interval. Although since I don't know in the link which brute is yours, one of them already has it so I don't think you really need both axe and flail.

Now, my turn. My brute has:


L13 => L14
116 Endurance
8 STR
15 AGL
5 SPD


Feline Agility, Fists of Fury, Toughened Skin.
Knife, Scimitar, Piouz.


Would you recommend gaining:
The offered weapon, a Lance, or an Endurance+3 boost?

Lance is a fine weapon, but your brute seems like its got enough weapons (for now). I'd say get +3 endurance. That's an 18HP boost to 134HP. If you think you need another weapon, you could get it, I suppose.

As for future things to aim for: whip and flail as weapons of course. As for skills, untouchable would stack nicely with your agility, sabotage and shock. Your brute is mainly vulnerable when it runs out of weapons so defensive skills like iron head and shield would help.

With backup, which way does it work?

Skill enables you
-to assist other brutes of yours in a fight
OR
- enables other brutes to assist that particular brute who has the skill?
On march 12, 2016
[9145718]

The way Backup works is that brute (with the skill) assists other brutes of the same (I think) or higher level. If the fight lasts long enough, the Backup brute will jump in and help out! After it's made several attacks, the Backup brute will go away again.


As for Backup and First Strike: there is apparently a bug where a Backup brute will attack forever, that is theorized to have some relation to First Strike. Hasn't happened for me yet, but you never know!
On march 12, 2016
[895738]

Yeah I have noticed that bug. Quite problematic indeed.

[895738]
LavaaHi, im new in mybrute and wanted to know if my brute doing well
Thank you. (Sorry for the english, i am student of this language)
Fight:
http://mybrute.muxxu.com/fight/145093...
(My brute is Guera)

No kidding, your brute has a brilliant build, and at level 7 too. Do not fork/change it at all.

Things to aim for after level 7:

Weapons - keep an eye out for broadsword, longsword, knife, mug and scimitar. Avoid ranged weapons like shuriken, pio-pio and noodle bowl at all times.
Skills - look for sabotage, shock, shield, iron head in particular. Any new skill should be welcomed, but avoid: reconnaissance, flash flood and chef.
Stats - prioritize strength, agility and endurance over speed.
Pets - up to you, but for late game reasons, avoid wolf/panther. They're ok in mid levels but drop off after that.


If you have a situation where you have a crummy level choice and it's something like Bone or +3 speed, take the speed of course.

Lavaasendos
Thanks for the answer but i have a question, the weapon i got is good?
I took it because is the first to go
(My english isn't good xD)

The sai is very, very good. It has 100% disarm chance (reduced chance against shields but still high, somewhere like 50%), which is what you want on a MA brute. It also has a decent block chance. By getting sabotage* next, if lucky on the level ups, you can force your opponent to rely on just their fists and you can win the fist fight outright, unless they are also a strength brute with MA.


* Don't confuse with saboteur skill (icon of sword with hilt shaped like dynamite), which is nowhere near as good as sabotage (icon of broken sword).

Aardvark

If u have recon only, your opponent will get 2 turns before you start and 4 if they have first strike. Recon without first strike is a disaster and will get worse as your level increases as your opponent's free turns will become more devastating. Often you will die before having a turn so your extra speed won't help at all.
Tbh recon even with first strike is poor if u intend to level up. Any brute with first strike will still get 2 free turns on you. If u have several brutes it could be fun to try having one with recon. If you have only 2 brutes, I would skip recon.

RogueTo add to why you should choose a new destiny, lightning bolt is the worst booster to have if you plan on leveling up your brute. If you're going to level up, best to have vitality/herculean strength/feline agility, and hope you eventually get immortality.

[895738]
KrinKYou should definitely pick up a new destiny but who said LB is the worst stat booster? What if you have HS,FA,LB along with Tragic potion or tamer? I think I've seen some builds with that and they look awesome

The healing skills are situational though. You could drink the tragic potion after receiving a small scratch and gain only 20HP back or you might use it later on. With vitality booster, that maximizes the healing you get back because it's based on proportion of missing HP.

Lightning Bolt is the sort of skill you get when you already have a couple of fast weapons or more at your disposal. Getting it early won't mean much unless you get a fast weapon soon after, while strength increases damage, agi increases dodge, accuracy and multi-hit chances and endurance increases tankiness.


If you look at Hehateme's Pinball Wizard brute, that is an ideal stats build for a brute. He can still pull off flawless victories despite only having about 20 speed. With this ranking system and grinding on to BL, the whole aim is to find a destiny for your brute that lasts on higher levels, as well as make it to level up faster in the early stages. Lightning Bolt usually doesn't cut it, but it depends on other skills and weapons too.

On november 16, 2016
[895738]
NereusRogue i strongly disagree. A brute with hs,fa,lb resistant and tamer is more effective than the same brute with vitality

But tamer scales better with vitality because you have more HP. The way speed scales is like a steep positive exponential graph between 2 and 20 and then it drops off beyond that. If there is a brute who can fit in 4 first strikes without the use of a fast weapon and without opponent having recon, I'd like to see that to prove myself wrong. With around 20-30 or so speed, if your brute has first strike (and assuming other brute doesn't), that brute will do at least 3 first strikes without fast weapons before other brute attacks. That's where speed is awesome.


Vitality has a more consistent scaling, while strength scales best followed by agility with a reverse kind of scaling compared to speed.


Resistant is an awesome skill but if your brute has high agi and high str, it doesn't mean much. It just gives you 5 lives against a heavy-hitter. Works well with agility rather than speed.

KrinKI think you need to fight 25 times. First, you have to play your highest brute ( the one with few opponents) until there's no more opponents left and then you must play the rest of your brutes. After that, you can check your main brute and fight again, if you reach the necessary amount of fights for the replacement

Is it work better? I used again tokens to get 20 fight but I get 15 wins and beside there's nothing opponent level 104 Brasta
On january 21, 2017
KrinK
DU30Is it work better? I used again tokens to get 20 fight but I get 15 wins and beside there's nothing opponent level 104 Brasta

When you use tokens and you have enough brutes to fight, 15 in your case, they'll refresh after you hit the hospital button. So, you play the first time and you get 10 out of 10 daily fights, right? If you visit the hospital, your brute will get another 10 fights. The number of opponents should be the same, 15 opponents to pick from (for Brasta)!


What I said was, when your main brute only has 9 or less opponents to fight, you need to play 25 fights with other brutes you own( Brasta won't count), and then those 9 or less players will appear again for your main brute.

On february 6, 2017
JohnMetropolis

Personally I would never turn down determination. It gives you a 70% chance to strike if you miss, and it stacks, meaning that if you miss once, determination can let you strike again. If you miss again, determination can let you strike again.


In higher levels when brutes have untouchable or higher agility, or when you're facing a wolf, even sai or lance can miss. Especially against shield, that would let your sai get in more hits and maybe disarm.


In short, in my opinion, definitely determination.

A1: Net is ok, but not brilliant. It goes well with a FB + heavy weapon combo for a guaranteed hit. Quite often, though, your brute would use net with no follow up and it therefore it does nothing, just guarantees you a hit.


Net is also a good counter against pets, namely jaguar/wolf and bear, but if your opponent has dogs as well, you might waste the net on them instead.

Net also does not combine well with bomb.



A2: I'd say keep determination in your build. It is a very useful skill in the long run.

On march 14, 2017
[895738]
Ismaelhttp://mybrute.muxxu.com/fight/148016...
Dog A or +3 in endurance?
My brute is Thronl

Excellent skills that early. It's a tough choice. If it were not for the endurance choice, I'd say the dog. The dog does provide a distraction, but remember it makes your brute more squishy, so if you think you can make up for that later on, then get dog.


Your brute is designed more for tankiness and strength by clearing out enemy weapons and winning through martial arts then squishiness because if you fail to disarm a brute with a strong weapon, then they'll beat you most of the time. The dog might provide a reprieve, but at times it might not.


Since it's so early, it may well be a forking opportunity, but it depends on what you get next down the path you've chosen.

On march 14, 2017
[7893843]
Ismael

Thanks for the opinion

Thanks , but, what is "tankiness"?


That means how durable your brute is. If your brute has a lot of hp/is very durable, it is a tanky brute (a tank is strong in real life.) If your brute has low hp it isn't durable, isn't a tank, and is 'squishy'.


Sendos makes a good point to take endurance, regardless of your choice I would do as he said and see what you would get if you chose the other option, after you rank up.

[895738]
tancredi

I was offered Reconnaissance.

I have noticed that brutes with Reconnaissance (and with very high speed in general) are usual easy targets in fights.

Is there any combination of skills that makes this choice worthwhile?

It's never worth it because speed scales so terribly in the game. You basically need to have 8-10x more speed than your opponent to get an extra attack off them. An easy example is a brute with 2 speed versus a brute with about 15-20 speed. The second gets an extra attack without any fast weapons involved every time. If you have double the speed of the second brute, you might even get a third attack in, but once the low speed brute gets a few levels in speed, the extra attacks are not as frequent. Obviously, fast weapons would make this easy and even add an extra attack or 2.

On july 3, 2017
[895738]
tancrediIf that is the case, then there is almost no point in boosting Speed at all, and Lightning Bolt is also basically useless. Is that right?AbelWell, speed boosts, at least for me, come exclusively from [bad weapon] or +3 Speed. Yes, LB is the worst stat boost you can get, along with recon. Don't get them. With speed, aim for around 20-30. Don't rush getting that speed if your brute is BL. As Abel stated above, it helps with first strike because you get another attack in. Combined with a fast weapon, that would involve an extra 1-2 attacks before the enemy can move. Add another attack if they have recon.


Not only that, there are other factors that counter speed: good reach chance, shield + CA, high agi especially with untouchable, enemy has fast weapons and tankiness. Speed needs both fast weapons on your brute, slow weapons on a slow brute and decent strength stat to make it worthwhile in late game. Of course, agility is also important too to ensure precision.


The only time speed is good is in the first few levels or so, especially the first level. A fight between a 2 3 2 brute and a 2 2 3 brute (str, agi, speed) with same HP will always be won by the faster brute. Then, when you get weapons like knife, it becomes pretty good when you get 1-2 extra strikes off an enemy per turn.


To compare speed to agility, agility is terrible in first 20 or so levels in the game unless you get a high agi + untouchable brute. Even though it's crap then, it's crucial to get it for later on, but you hope you don't have to spend heaps of levels getting early agi stats on a brute that has no impressive early levels. With speed it's the opposite. If your brute has 2 speed and it's around level 15, quite a few brutes will get an easy extra strike off you each turn without any fast weapons involved. So getting a couple of levels in speed at that time at least minimizes this, but does nothing more, besides slight help against the remaining slow brutes.


So if you still intend to build a speed brute and use it in BL, stick to ear cutting, I guess. Avoid recon.

tancredi

Thanks for the overview!

How come Agility is terrible in the early levels but becomes so vital later?
How does this work? Is this an artifact of the algorithm that determines the hitting chances? Why a brute with Agi 3 vs 15 in the early levels is fine, but a brute with, say, Agi 15 vs 50 at higher levels is in troubles?

And what would be a decent Agility value to aim for (given that not every brute gets Feline Agility and lots of Agi boost)? Is 20-25 enough around levels 50-60?

Agility scales really well with more levels basically. A 20 or less agi difference means very little in a fist fight (maybe dodge a few hits maybe more, maybe none). It means a bit more with certain weapons, unless they're fast weapons or the leek weapon. I don't know the exact formula but if you compare a 50 agility difference to a 50 speed difference in brutes, you'll see why. With 50 agi difference, you have a decent chance of dodging fast weapons. And of course, relentless and determination do counter high agi brutes, at least you have crazy multi-hit chance as well.
On july 6, 2017
k0l3
Iced Guardian

After fighting for years on Brutal Legend I can say that agility is hands down and by far the best skill to boost. Then comes strenght and health and down the road, abandoned, speed. If you have skills like 6th sense, shield and counter-attack the more the other brute attacks, the more it suffers without even taking your attack turns.

Agility is so OP as it doesn't boost only your dodging chance, which is the best and safest way to avoid damage without losing health or weapons, but it also influences your ENEMY's dodge rate, which is insane. I've been noticing that enemies with higher agility (more so if they have untouchable), also makes me dodge less than when I fight enemies with lower agility than me. So the skill works on both ends, making it so OP. I have a brute with good strenght, untouchable but sadly poor agility. And as I only have one stat booster I pray daily for it to get feline agility at some point.

So now I can go two different paths which leads me to these stat comparisons at lvl 15.

A) +3 strength, +3 endurance, +3 agility, +9 speed, Hammer (skill).

B) +3 strength, +5 endurance, +1 agility, +3 speed, Lance, Shock, Reconnaissance



Shock is obviously really nice combo with Sabotage since I dont have thief. Reconnaissance is nice because I got First Strike which evens out the disadvantage from Recon.

Reconaissance is not worth it at all, honestly. Yes the loss of shock is bad but there's no guarantee you don't get it later on anyway.

my main brute is a melee only brute with said hammer/fiercebrute/firststrike/MA combo. It's hilarious instantly winning fights, your only weakness is dogs/pets, in which case you can kind of counter with bomb/cryofthedamned/hypnosis, but it's a risk as hammer could still get used first.

On august 3, 2018
[895738]

Toughened skin is indeed an utterly useless skill that does not even scale as you level your brute, but you should get the skill. Why? Because it rolls frequently as you level up. You will likely have that exact same choice of toughened skin or stats if you keep ignoring it. Just choose it so that you don't have to roll it over and over again.


The same can't be said for much rarer and worse skills like recon, saboteur (not to be confused with sabotage) and chef. Ignore them at all times.

On december 4, 2018
[4337424]
ENNMBackup or +3 Strenght?

Depends... Backup can be extremely good if this isn't your main brute, but instead want to help train your main brute up. When activated on Brute A, they'll appear on all brutes when training (only training, not tournys) randomly and help in the fight.

If however this is your main brute, stick to strength. I would highly suggest anyone with multiple brutes on one account, to get a decent brute with BackUp and FirstStrike to make levelling a lot easier for all your other brutes. (Or multiple brutes with backup in fact, if you want one for the level 20>30 range, 30>40 range... 50+ range...)

Be47I had chosen the same destiny recently, but my choise of skills is different. It happened because I followed another path for my brute by choosing another things this time?

I believe it goes like this, let's say you choose speed +3 for your first level up over a knife. If you start over again and choose the knife next time around, you have the same destiny, but a different order. If your brute was destined to always have immortality, he'd still get it, it's just at a different level than what it was from when you took speed +3 first. (Maybe instead of it being at level 10, it's now at level 20).
